Title: Designing for Everyone: Accessibility in VS Code with Megan Rogge
Author: Visual Studio Code
Description:
Subscribe - https://www.vscodepodcast.com

Megan Rogge, Software Engineer on VS Code, joins James to explore how accessibility is woven into the culture and engineering practices of Visual Studio Code. From screen reader support to sound signals and contrast themes, this episode reveals the thoughtful design behind features that empower every developer.

Episode Links: Accessibility in VS Code: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/configure/accessibility/accessibility

Paper - Coding Non-Visually in VS Code: http://jooyoungseo.me/assets2023\_vscode/

Chapters: 00:00 – Intro & Megan’s Role 01:30 – Why Accessibility Matters 03:00 – Supporting Screen Reader Users 06:30 – Community Feedback & Testing 09:45 – Terminal Output in Chat 13:15 – Discoverability & Accessible Views 16:00 – Color Contrast & Themes 18:30 – Sound Signals & Inputs 21:00 – Accessibility in Generated Code 23:30 – Final Thoughts & Getting Involved
